citation.article-title: Nitratiruptor tergarcus gen. nov., sp. nov. and Nitratifractor salsuginis gen. nov., sp. nov., nitrate-reducing chemolithoautotrophs of the epsilon-Proteobacteria isolated from a deep-sea hydrothermal system in the Mid-Okinawa Trough.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Nitratifractor [Ni.tra.ti.frac′tor. N.L. masc. n. nitras, -atis nitrate; L. masc. n. fractor breaker; N.L. masc. n. Nitratifractor nitrate-breaker (-reducer)].
Non-motile short rods that stain Gram-negative.
Able to utilize molecular hydrogen as an electron donor and oxygen or nitrate as an electron acceptor.
The G+C content of genomic DNA is about 35 mol%.
Major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1, C16 : 1 and C16 : 0.
On the basis of the 16S rRNA gene sequence, the genus Nitratifractor is distantly related to the genus Sulfurovum.
Members of the genus Nitratifractor occur in deep-sea hydrothermal fields.
The type species is Nitratifractor salsuginis.
